thread.title: IN THE HUDDLE How area NFL players fared in Week 6
thread.title_full: IN THE HUDDLE How area NFL players fared in Week 6

title: IN THE HUDDLE How area NFL players fared in Week 6
text:
Published: Mon, October 19, 2015 @ 12:05 a.m. 
Cleveland Browns 
John Greco, OL, Boardman — Started at right guard in a 26-23 overtime loss to the Broncos. 
Denver Broncos 
Derek Wolfe, DL, Beaver Local — Started at left defensive end and made two tackles in the win over the Browns. He was flagged 15 yards for a personal foul against Browns quarterback Josh McCown late in the fourth quarter. 
Green Bay Packers 
Corey Linsley, C, Boardman — Started at center in 27-20 victory over the Chargers. 
Houston Texans 
Cecil Shorts, WR, Mount Union — Started at wide receiver and caught four passes for 61 yards in a 31-20 win over the Jaguars. 
John Simon, LB, Cardinal Mooney — Started at linebacker against the Jaguars and made two tackles including a sack. 
New Orleans Saints 
Mike McGlynn, OL, Fitch — Was a substitute in a 31-21 win over the Falcons. 
Washington Redskins 
Pierre Garcon, WR, Mount Union — Started at wide receiver, made five receptions for 28 yards and scored a touchdown in a 34-20 loss to the Jets. 
Staff report
